title: Wild Cats Identification
description: How well do you know the wild cats of the world? Test your knowledge of these fascinating felines

questions.question: Which small wild cat native to Africa is known for its incredibly long legs relative to its body, making it the tallest of all small cats?
Which wild cat from Central and South America has a beautiful spotted coat and is the largest wild cat in the Americas after the jaguar and puma?
Which medium-sized wild cat has distinctive tufted ears with long black hair extending from the tips?
Which wild cat is adapted to desert environments and has fur-covered paws to protect against hot sand?
Which wild cat native to the mountains of Central Asia has an extremely long, thick tail and dense fur for surviving cold temperatures?
Which small wild cat from southern Africa is considered one of the deadliest cats in the world, with a hunting success rate of about 60%?
Which Asian wild cat has a stocky body, round face, and extremely dense fur, and is sometimes called the 'ugliest cat in the world'?
Which wild cat from Southeast Asia is known for its ability to catch fish by diving into water and has partially webbed paws?
Which North American wild cat has a short 'bobbed' tail and is the most abundant wild cat on the continent?
Which wild cat from Southeast Asia has cloud-shaped markings on its coat and is considered a bridge between big cats and small cats?
Which wild cat is believed to be the ancestor of the domestic cat and is native to Africa and the Middle East?
Which wild cat species found in Sri Lanka and India holds the title of the smallest wild cat in the world?
Which wild cat from South America is the smallest wild cat in the Americas and lives in temperate rainforests?
Which North American wild cat has large snowshoe-like paws that act as natural snowshoes in deep snow?
Which small wild cat from South America has an extraordinary ability to rotate its ankle joints 180 degrees, allowing it to climb down trees headfirst?
